name: Dense Structure
description: This smell arises when an EA repository has excessive and dense dependencies without any particular structure.
detection: We prepare a graph for each repository to detect the smell. Each component is treated as a node and any reference from the component to another component is treated as an edge. We then compute the average degree of the graph (|E|/|V|). A graph with more than 1.75 average degree suffers from this smell. (One could also test the clustering coefficient)
consequences: Modifications to the system may be cumbersome and many dependencies have to be added, due to the high coupling.
cause: Inefficient abstraction that needs high coupling of components to work.
solution: Extensive restructuring and rethinking of the architecture is needed, if the problems get noticeable.

relatedAntiPatterns.name: Hub-like Modularization
relatedAntiPatterns.description: This smell arises when an abstraction has dependencies (both incoming and outgoing) with a large number of other abstractions, being a single point of failure.

relatedAntiPatterns.name: Weakened Modularity
relatedAntiPatterns.description: Each module must strive for high cohesion and low coupling. This smell arises when a module exhibits high coupling and low cohesion.
